thread.title: Mumbai to host ARC from January 24
thread.title_full: Mumbai to host ARC from January 24 - The Times of India

author: timesofindia.indiatimes.com
title: Mumbai to host ARC from January 24
text:
MUMBAI: The prestigious Asian racing Conference (ARC) returns to India after a gap of two decades. The 36th ARC will be organized by the Indian Turf Authorities under the aegis of Asian Racing Federation at Mumbai from January 24 to 29, 2016. Eminent horse owner and breeder Dr.Cyrus S Poonawalla is chairman of the organizing committee.
At a press meet on Monday , Dr. Poonawalla informed that the 36th ARC will kick start from January 24, the day of the running of the Indian Oaks at the Mahalaxmi Racecourse where many other top races will be held on that day along with the Asian Racing Federation Trophy.
There will be various committee meetings on January 25 while business sessions of the conference will be held between January 26 to 28 at Oberoi and Trident Hotels. At the end of it, there will be a tour of Poonawalla Stud Farm in Pune on January 29.
There will be discussions on wagering landscape, breeding, racing media and the 21st century fan, marketing of racing, racecourse management, handicapping and racing programmes, international horse movement, drug free racing, and illegal gambling. Every evening there will be various programmes to showcase Indian culture, music, bollywood etc. More than 700 international delegates are expected to attend apart from a big number of Indian delegates. The registration fees for international participants are Rs 90,000 while for the Indians it is Rs 60,000. Registration can be done through http:www.arcindia2016.com.
